response.summary: Durante estos años de estudio he desarrollado especial interés en control de sistemas, automatización, técnicas de inteligencia artificial y microcontroladores. Por otra parte he tenido la oportunidad de realizar proyectos orientados a la teleoperación de robots enfocado al control bilateral y al manejo de robots a través de la plataforma ROS .Teniendo en cuenta esto, deseo investigar acerca de técnicas de control robusto, implementación digital de controladores, teleoperación de robots en tiempo real y robótica móvil.
response.skills: Ingeniería, Inteligencia artificial, Robótica, Automatización, Microcontroladores, Java, C++, Programación en C, Redes neuronales, Programación orientada a objetos (POO), Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, AWS CloudFormation, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2

profile_positions.description:
- Realizar la labor de tutor en para las asignaturas del área de programación: Programación de computadores, programación orientada a objetos, Estructuras de datos y métodos numéricos.
- Crear material digital para ayudar a los estudiantes con dudas e inquietudes con respecto a los temas de las asignaturas del área de programación.
profile_positions.title: Estudiante auxiliar

company.name: MADE - Competence Center Industry 4.0
company.description:
MADE, Competence Center for Industry 4.0, is composed of 46 companies, (technology providers, consultants, system integrators, training experts), 1 public body (Inail) and 4 universities (Politecnico di Milano, University of Bergamo, Brescia and Pavia).

MADE is a digital and sustainable factory that supports manufacturing companies on the path of digital transformation towards Industry 4.0 through training, education, and consulting activities. It provides a wide range of knowledge, methods and tools on digital technologies ranging from design to engineering, production management to delivery, and end-of-life management.

With its large 2,500-square-meter demo-center, training rooms, and co-working and meeting spaces, it represents a one-of-a-kind solution. The special growth path toward digital transformation set up is based on these steps: informing and showing Industry 4.0 technologies, explaining through ad-hoc training activities, and finally transferring and implementing through projects the technological solutions.

MADE - Competence Center Industry 4.0 is a technical interlocutor to turn to in order to manage innovation activities, technology transfer, applied research and assistance in the implementation of Industry 4.0 technologies, to maintain a high competitive level by restructuring organizational and business models and strategy of one's company.

The goal of MADE cc i4.0's School of Competencies 4.0 courses is to provide SMEs with a broad and strategic view of the role of digital technologies in businesses and to make them understand the many opportunities for business innovation that can result from new technologies.
